channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly Tipping, 22nd July
item.description:
This area is used by local shops to keep there waste bins. The problem is the bins are always overflowing, and as some of the shops sell food, there is always a strong smell of rotting food. These bins are located between Boots and TG Jones on Eltham High Street. Added to this people seem to think this area is also a public toilet and use it as such anytime day and night, apart from being quite concerning this adds to.the vile stench that eminates from the bin area. Even in the winter the smell is there but obviously it's much worse in the summer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Eltham High Street, Well Hall, Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Groups of people drinking and leaving litter, 22nd July
item.description:
There's usually a group of people drinking heavily, being noisy and leaving rubbish and litter in this area including chairs and their empty bottles.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chairs blocking pavement, 22nd July
item.description:
This is the 3rd report in a month and still no response. Ebenezer's barber shop keeps blocking the pavement with chairs, stools and the same bike in the same place. In the photo you can see a woman and young girl had to walk into the road to get passed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing palladin bins, 22nd July
item.description:
This is a common occurrence where these bins are always overflowing and people also fly tip by the bins. I believe they are emptied by a private contractor. The area is always covered in rubbish as no one seems to take responsibility to clean it up. I assume the local shops pay someone to clear this rubbish. It is an absolute eyesore and the smell in the hot weather is horrendous. The bins are located on the entrance to the NCP carpark at the rear of Argos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Chequers Parade, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The picking up of rubbish at side of 95 midfield way, 22nd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Horsell Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several foot wide potholes on Highview road near house no. 9 & 8C, 22nd July
item.description:
Several large potholes, most are more than 1 foot wide have been on Highview road for over a year. Rocks are flung to either side of the road when cars drive over them causing risk to pedestrians and property. It also poses danger to cyclists and road users as they swerve to avoid potholes. Previous repair did not work.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8b, Highview Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More fly tipping on building, 22nd July
item.description:
Hi, I’ve reported this twice this week already but more fly tipping rubbish has appeared. Please resolve

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal parking on double yellow lines, 22nd July
item.description:
Cars and vans are constantly parking here at all times for how ever long they want and whenever they want. This is completely unacceptable. These are double yellow lines and nobody should be parking here at all.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 22nd July
item.description:
It started as few items dumped by a local garage but now the church opposite have had a clear out by the new owners and added to the rubbish (several residents asked them not to) - there’s drug paraphernalia, decaying food etc. and every day it gets worse and worse. It’s been there for weeks and I’m sure it’s causing vermin issues. Please remove it asap and please ask local businesses to dispose of their rubbish in the correct way. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 93, Camberwell Station Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Strong sewage smell along this pavement path daily, 22nd July
item.description:
Revoluting smell present at this street as you walk past. Now present daily, and unhealthy. Note this has been a recurrent long term issue and previoulsy closed problem prematurely (FixMyStreet ref: 3562028.) Please can this be rectified. Also reported to Pollution and Regulation team
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich New Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cavendish Road, 22nd July
item.description:
Good evening - there is clearly a surface water issue on Cavendish Road, which is exacerbated by the circumstance that the only 4 gullies on the street are often blocked by leaves. Ive attached one picture for illustration of a recent waterstream that was the result of just 10 minutes of heavy rain, creating surface water flooding potential for properties on the road. I was wondering if Brent Council is open to considering shorter or longer term fixes to the problem, ranging from pruning the trees to prevent gully blockages, cleaning the gullies more frequently to creating additional gullies? Many thanks!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car in Rudgwick Court, Woodville Street, 22nd July
item.description:
This car has been abandoned in our car park since Monday 14th July 2025. It doesn't have an MOT and has a DVLA enforcement notice stuck to the window. The driver's window is open and the bonnet is also open.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodville Street, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet
